I can't believe that you'd take a rediculous take on
this Nic. I mean this is something that is established
in Cannon and to much greater extents in both distance
and mass than what's happened here. I honestly thought
this group would actually use common sense with
RPGing, rather than taking the attitude of 'cause the
rules say so. I'm sorry but I can't play in an RPG
where the rules give way to common sense, which in my
opinion is the same bad gming that resulted in a
massive adendum in the REF Field Guide sourcebook for
the robotech rpg because people were using a total
lack of common sense with things like regular humans
versus explosives  where a player under the rules
could brush off an explosion at point blank range by
using their sdc or physical resistance to damage.  I'm
sorry, but I'm not gonna play in an RPG where common
sense plays second fiddle to the rules rather than
underlying them.  I'm outta here. 

 --- Nic <Proudwing500k@...> wrote: 
---------------------------------
1) Teleportation is allowed as an introduction only.
Primus may be 
in there, but it still is banned by the rules.

2) The idea to bring Unicron has the objetive to make
intersting RPG 
experiences. To reach that objetive, current chars
have to develop 
their weapons and skills in order to defat him...
Impossilbe??? Not 
so.  Remember when the aparently weak defeats the
mighty Minions. 
They're NPCs, so we'll make it possible the way it is.
The solar 
flare idea ruins that because it threatens Earth and
simply gets to 
kill Unicron in one shot. Killing him like this ruins
the whole 
point and the fun of the game. Try something else that
will allow 
everyone to get through the battle. 

If you want to tell us of your concept in order to
make it more 
legal (speaking to everyone), you're welcome.
